div.l: That it hadde ben to late for to crye
And shortly for to seyn þei were at on
Now play alayn for I wol speke of Iohn
This Iohan lith stille a forlong wei or two
And to hym self he makith routh ⁊and wo
Allas qduod he þis is a wikke Iape
Now may I seen þat I is but an Ape
Ȝet hathe my felow som what for his harm
He hathe the Millers doughter in his arme
He auntred hym and hath his nedes spede
And I ly as a draf sak in my bedde
And whan þis Iape is told an oþ̉er day
I shal be hold a daf a Cokenay
I wil arise and auntred it be my fayth
Vnhardy is vnsely þus men saithe
And vp he rose and softly he went
Vn to þe cradel and in his hond it hent
And bare it soft vn to his beddes fette
Sone after þe wif hir routyng lete
And gan to wake and went hir out to pisse
And come a gayn and can hir cradel mysse
And grouped her ⁊and þer but she fond noon
Alas ꝙquod she I hadd almost mys gon
I hadd almost gon to þe clerkes bedde
Eye bn̄enedicite þan hadd I foule I spede
And forth she goth til she þᵉ cradel fonde
She gropith alle wey forth with hir hond
And found þe bedd ⁊and þought nouȝt but god
By cause þat þe cradil by hit stode
And nyst wher she was for it was derke
But faire and wele she crep in to þe clerke
And lith ful stille and wold haue caught a slepe
With in a while þis Iohn þe clerke vp lepe
And on þis god wif he lith on sore
So mery a fette ne hadde she not ful ȝore
He prikith hard and depe as he were madde
This Ioly lif haue þise two clerkys ledde
Til þat þe þrid cok by gan to syng
Aleyn wax wery in the dawenyng
